skill.name: doc-sync
skill.description: Keeps IdeaVim documentation in sync with code changes. Use this skill when you need to verify documentation accuracy after code changes, or when checking if documentation (in doc/, README.md, CONTRIBUTING.md) matches the current codebase. The skill can work bidirectionally - from docs to code verification, or from code changes to documentation updates.
skill.summary: Keeps IdeaVim documentation in sync with code changes. Use this skill when you need to verify docume...
skill.author: unspecified

security_audit.summary: The skill is procedural guidance only and contains no executable code. No data access, network calls, or command execution logic is present in the scanned files.

content.user_title: Verify IdeaVim docs after code changes
content.value_statement: Documentation can drift after code updates and create broken examples. This skill guides a structured workflow to align docs with working code.
actual_capabilities: Identify documentation locations in doc/, README.md, and CONTRIBUTING.md
Extract code examples and function signatures from docs
Review git history for removals and breaking changes
Produce a documentation sync report with discrepancies
limitations: Requires access to repository code and git history
Does not update docs for internal only implementation changes
Focused on IdeaVim documentation locations named in the skill
Ambiguous API behavior still needs human judgment

use_cases.title: Post release audit
use_cases.description: Confirm documentation reflects recent API changes after a release.

use_cases.title: Doc review before PR
use_cases.description: Validate examples and parameter names before submitting documentation updates.

use_cases.title: Regression triage
use_cases.description: Check whether reported doc issues map to real API changes.

prompt_templates.title: Single file check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check doc/ideavim-mappings.md against current code and list mismatches.

prompt_templates.title: Change based review
prompt_templates.prompt: I changed MappingScope.kt. Identify affected docs and propose updates.

prompt_templates.title: Folder audit
prompt_templates.scenario: Scan all docs in a folder
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit all files in doc/ for outdated examples and summarize findings.

prompt_templates.title: Signature audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate all examples using map(), nmap(), and vmap() against current API signatures.

output_examples.input: Check README.md for outdated mappings examples
output: Found two examples with removed parameters
README.md should reference the new mapping scope name
No other issues detected in the README

best_practices: Start with a working implementation to establish ground truth
Prioritize removed or renamed API elements when comparing docs
Keep updates minimal and aligned with existing documentation style
anti_patterns: Updating wording when behavior is still accurate
Skipping verification of named parameters in examples
Assuming docs are correct without checking working code

faq.question: Is this compatible with any repository?
faq.answer: It is designed for the IdeaVim project structure and doc locations.

faq.question: What are the usage limits?
faq.answer: No built in limits, but accuracy depends on access to code and git history.

faq.question: Can it integrate with CI?
faq.answer: It provides a workflow you can run manually or wrap in CI checks.

faq.question: Does it access sensitive data?
faq.answer: No, it only reviews repository files you provide.

faq.question: What if outputs seem incorrect?
faq.answer: Recheck ground truth examples and verify API signatures in code.

faq.question: How does it compare to a linter?
faq.answer: It validates documentation logic and examples, not code style or syntax.
